column4: hi, anyone here can fix my fresh ubuntu install? I receive this error on start first time after install: "Master Boot Record Error"
I'm totally newbie in linux, I can activate the vnc
good question
linux is too hard for me, I just tried the wizard to install and no luck.. "Master Boot Record Error"
what probs do you have that require VNC aid?
ah okey, try to connect the linux hd by itself and boot

I never used any linux.. today I install one fresh new HD in my computer, run the ubuntu live cd 8.0.4, click in 'install' button from desktop, I just follow the steps of wizard to install, after done I restart the system and now I receive this message in black screen: "Master Boot Record Error". I'm not able to fix it, I never used Linux.
but how can you use VNC when it dosent boot u p?
with live cd
how are your hds ordered?
I'm on other HD now with windows... I will remove this hd, and put the other with linux.. run the live cd, activate the vnc and send ip for you access it
so you only have one 1 hd connected at all time?
yes two hd, but I want connect only one per time to install the SO, after this I will connect both hd'd and manage the boot with the "F8" feature of my motherboard
dont try to boot from linux with both hardrives connected
yes, I use only one hd.. I plug this hd with windows now only to get help here, I always try boot the linux only with 1 hd
reinstall linux with both hds connected
this is my second attempt, I can't intall with both hds connected because I dont want no one boot loader manage like grub or lilo to manage my windows hd (show menu to choose SO to start)
hmm, does you get that master boot record when you ONLY boot from your linux hardrive? And dont have windows hardrive connected ?
exactly
dont know really, sorry :/
not only have 5 minutes to check my grub via vnc?
ca ntry though
